journal-title-group.journal-title: ETC: A Review of General Semantics

ref.mixed-citation: Popper's essay, "The Myth of the Framework," in Eugene Freeman, ed., The Abdication of Philosophy (La Salle, Illinois: Open Court Press, 1976).

Friedrich Nietzsche, The Will To Power, Walter Kaufman, ed., Walter Kaufman and R.J. Hollingdale, trans. (Notebooks written 1883- 1888; first published, Der Wille zur Macht, 1901; ed./trans. first published 1967; rpt. New York: Vintage Books, 1968), pp. 276 ff.

Michel Foucault, The History of Sexuality; Volume I: An Introduction (La Volonte de Savoir, Paris: Editions Gallimard, 1976; trans. New York: Random House, 1978; rpt. New York, Vintage Books, 1980), pp. 101-102.

Adorno et al., op. cit., pp. 210-215.

Karl Otto Apel (an attempt to combine Wittgenstein's linguistic philosophy and the Marxist critical theory of Adorno and Habermas), Towards A Transformation of Phi- losophy (Transformation der Philosophie, Frankfurt am Main, 1972, 1973; trans. London: Routledge & Kegan Paul, 1980);

Paul Ricoeur (a significant development of hermeneutics from Heidegger and Gadamer, with con- nections made to Marxist critical theory, linguistic philosophy, semiotics, post- structuralism, and critical rationalism), Hermeneutics and the Human Sciences (Cam- bridge: Cambridge University Press, 1981);
Richard Rorty (an attempt to harmonize Wittgenstein, Heidegger, and Dewey into a new pragmatism), Philosophy and the Mirror of Nature (Princeton: Princeton University Press, 1979),
The Consequences of Prag- matism: Essays 1972-1980 (Minneapolis: University of Minnesota Press, 1982).
